articles.title: UPDATE 4-Trump unveils $12 billion aid package for farmers hit by trade war
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Monday unveiled a $12 billion aid package for American farmers, the latest government effort to shore up a key political constituency hurt by the financial fallout from his trade policies.

articles.content:

articles.title: Ex-Trump lawyer Alina Habba resigns as top federal prosecutor in New Jersey
articles.description: In a statement posted on social media, Alian Habba,41, assailed the court’s ruling as political, but said she was resigning to protect the stability and integrity of her office.
articles.content: US President Donald Trump’s former personal attorney, Alina Habba, stepped down on Monday as the acting US attorney for the District of New Jersey, ending a turbulent three-month battle over the legality of her appointment. She announced her resignat... [2623 chars]

articles.title: Farmers and innovators say there is potential in Australia's untapped biofuel sector
articles.description: Fuels produced from waste and agricultural feedstock are tipped to play a role in cutting emissions, but a leading Victorian farmer says political will is required to seize the opportunity.
articles.content:
Fifth-generation farmer Brett Hosking is preparing for harvest in Quambatook, western Victoria, where he grows wheat, barley and canola.

articles.title: Unlawful Appointment: Alina Habba Steps Down Amid Legal Turmoil
articles.description: Alina Habba, formerly acting U.S. Attorney for New Jersey, resigned after her appointment was deemed unlawful. A federal court ruling found that the Trump administration bypassed legal procedures. Habba now serves as senior adviser to Attorney General Pam Bondi, amidst ongoing legal controversies involving political appointments.
articles.content:
Alina Habba, a former legal representative for President Donald Trump, announced her resignation as acting U.S. Attorney for New Jersey. Her departure follows a federal appeals court ruling that her appointment was unlawful.

articles.title: Final farewell for controversial political kingmaker
articles.description: A prominent figure in Labor politics, controversial deal-maker Graham Richardson will be remembered at a state funeral on Tuesday.
articles.content:
Graham Richardson, a former Labor heavyweight dogged by corruption scandals and a penchant for factionalism, is receiving a state funeral.
Mr Richardson died last month aged 76.
